Fales Library and Special Collections
Lester Afflick Papers
Afflick, Lester, 1956-2000
MSS.097
7 Linear Feet (7 boxes)
ca. 1975-1998 Lester Afflick was a downtown poet, writer and once co-editor of 'The Door Newsletter.' The collection is an assemblage of his writings and biographical material which illustrate aspects of his style and the downtown scene in general of the 1990's.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions. Please contact the Fales Library & Special Collections for more information and to schedule an appointment, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Provenance
The Lester Afflick papers were a gift of the Lester Afflick estate. They were initially sorted by friends of Lester Afflick.
Biographical Note
Lester Afflick was a downtown poet, writer and once co-editor of 'The Door Newsletter.' The collection is an assemblage of his writings and biographical material which illustrate aspects of his style and the downtown scene in general of the 1990's. Afflick died of a heart attack in 2000.
Scope and Content Note
The Lester Afflick papers are comprised mostly of correspondence and manuscripts of his poetry.
SERIES DESCRIPTIONS
Series 1: Correspondence contains correspondence to and from Afflick. It is arranged in chronological order with the exception of a folder of correspondence with Martin Afflick.
Series 2: Manuscripts consists of three subseries.
Missing Title
Subseries A contains materials and drafts of Afflick's poetry. They are arranged alphabetically according to a comprehensive list provided by Afflick.
Subseries B contains materials from poetry collections and projected collections. The last folder contains a comprehensive list of Afflick's poems.
Subseries C contains materials manuscripts of plays, essays, and articles.
Subseries D contains disks of Afflick and printouts from those working disks.
Series 3: Biographic Materials contains a small number of biographic materials such as copies of Afflick's birth certificate, announcements, immigration papers, and scrapbooks.
Series 4: Afflick's Personal Library consists of periodicals in Afflick's collection including The Door Newsletter of which he was a co-editor. This series also includes manuscripts of other poets' works.
Arrangement
Folders arranged chronologically or alphabetically depending on the nature of the series. Correspondence is arranged chronologically. Poetry is arranged alphabetically by title.
The files are grouped into 4 series.
Missing Title
Series I: Correspondence
Series II: Manuscripts
Series III: Biographic Materials
Series IV: Works by Other Writers/Poets
Separated Material
There is no information about materials that are associated by provenance to the described materials that have been physically separated or removed.
Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Lester Afflick Papers; MSS 097; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Lester Afflick, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
Poets, American -- 20th century. Drawings Correspondence. New York (N.Y.) -- Intellectual life -- 20th century. Downtown writers. Magazines (Periodicals) New York (N.Y.). Literature, Experimental. Manuscripts for publication.
